Task Description: Passive viewing, pictures of objects and a checkerboard pattern.
Imagine playing a game of tennis.
3AFC, indicating color of stimulus word (3 colors), comparing conditions in which color-word mapping is congruent or incongruent (Stroop task).
2AFC, indicating if current stimulus in stream of letters matches letter displayed two items previously (2-back). Target can be present (+) or absent (-).
2AFC, indicating if a tone is short (100ms) or long (175ms)

2AFC, indicating if simple multiplication equations (e.g. 2x7=14) are correct or incorrect. For control task, participants view a series of four numbers and indicate presence/absence of target number (e.g., 1).
2AFC, indicating if picture (scenes, animals, foods) is pleasant or unpleasant.
2AFC, indicating if picture depicts sad or happy face.
Go-NoGo task with positive (Go) or negative (No Go) words.
2AFC to indicate if short story contains true or false belief (Theory of Mind task)
Passive viewing of fixation cross.
2AFC, indicating if current stimulus in stream of objects matches object displayed two items previously (2-back). Target can be present (+) or absent (-).
Verb generation task requiring covert responses to visually-presented nouns, either repeating the stimulus (Read) or generating a verb associated with the noun (Generate).
Imagine walking from room to room in childhood home, with a cue specifying the path to be taken (e.g., ÒImagine walking from the kitchen to the bedroom, stopping to look around at different roomsÓ).
6-element sequence, either requiring one key press with each of six fingers (bimanual) or repetition of a single key press with one finger (unimanual left or right).
Passive viewing of videos of knots being tied, learning the name of the knot (presented at top of screen) for a latter recall test.
2AFC, indicating if target stimulus (ÒLÓ) is present among distractors (ÒTÓ), with varying set size (4, 8, 12).
Memorize a spatial mapping of numbers (either, 1, 4, or 7) for subsequent recall

Mentally rotate target object to determine whether it can be brought into alignment with baseline object. Difficulty is measured by angular disparity between target and baseline image. Stimuli were obtained from Ganis and Kievit (2015)52
2AFC to identify intact point-light walkers (either happy or sad) or scrambled walkers (fast or slow). Stimuli obtained from Troje et al. (2017)53
Apply task-rule set (logic, sensory, & motor rules) to two consecutively presented stimuli (rectangles: either red or blue, vertical or horizontal)
2AFC task to indicate if five sequentially-presented words comprise a semantically meaningful sentence. Stimuli obtained from DÕMello et al. (2017)56
Conditions: True Prediction, Prediction Violated , Prediction Scrambled

Task Description: Execute a fast motor response to an imperative signal (white cross) that appears in one of 1, 2, or 4 primed positions
Passive viewing of a nature clip of kickboxing kangaroos, taken from ÒPlanet Earth II: IslandsÓ
Passive viewing of an emotional love story between two characters from the Pixar movie ÒUpÓ
Passive viewing of an aesthetically-pleasing clip that depicts a diverse scenery, taken from Vimeo
